text: Raymond Earl Fosse (April 4, 1947 â€“ October 13, 2021) was an American professional baseball player and television sports color commentator. He played in Major League Baseball (MLB) as a catcher from 1967 to 1979. He won the World Series two times with the Oakland Athletics. Fosse died of cancer on October 13, 2021, at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in the United States Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:Seattle Mariners players Category:Milwaukee Brewers players Category:Sportspeople from Illinois Category:American sports commentators
title: Ray Fosse
